Posts.Content: I took 1650mg Xeloda morning and evening, 3 large 500mg and a small 150mg. It can give you diarrhea but that balanced my morphine constipation effect! I had extremely mild hand-foot syndrome, I used Udderly Smooth cream overnight every few days on feet with socks. That’s quite a hit of radiation, I had 5 low dose treatments for my lumbar back pain. I’m 70 too, dx MBC 9/15 in bones, it’s throughout my torso and numerous small liver tumours have run together, lungs are OK. I had a CT scan after taking Xeloda 3 months to confirm it was working. You sound really fit, Xeloda did not affect my energy level. Ask your oncologist what they’d recommend. Xeloda is an oral chemo and some do very well on it, others have to switch to another drug like me eventually. It’s worth trying for 3 months. Wishing you all the very best, Angela
Posts.Title: Life on Taxol

Posts.Content: Ibrance worked about 8 months for me, thinned my hair, then Xeloda for a year, hair thickened great! It’s much easier taking pills daily than chemo. I’m now having Paclitaxel since mid-April, once a week 3/4 weeks. Got my hair shaved short but I will lose all. I’d definitely recommend Xeloda first.
Posts.Title: Life on Taxol

Posts.Content: I was on Ibrance and Letrozole. When it quit working I went on Xeloda. Effective for me a year, other folks have gotten two years and more. I’ve had two taxol treatments, they nixed the third of my 3/4 week schedule because of low neutrophils. Next treatment May 14. I definitely recommend Xeloda for as long as it holds metastases stable. My hair thickened too on it. Now after two taxol infusions my hair is falling out so I got a buzz cut from Bill the Barber lol. Last week got a port and once healed can swim. Taxol is more tiring and time-consuming. Good luck Syl70,
